item.title: Removing --headless=old from Chrome
item.description: Chrome 132 no longer includes the old Headless mode. Migrate to chrome-headless-shell or the new Headless mode.

item.title: What's new in DevTools, Chrome 131
item.description: Debug CSS with Gemini, annotate findings and get insights in the Performance panel, spot excessive layout shifts and non-composited animations, and more.

item.title: Add content to the margins of web pages when printed using CSS
item.description: Create custom headers and footers when printing webpages.

item.title: Monitor live Core Web Vitals metrics in the Performance panel
item.description: Monitor live Core Web Vitals metrics in the Performance panel.

item.title: Help your users sign-in smoothly with seamless credential sharing
item.description: Seamless credential sharing lets you securely signal to password managers that your users can sign in using the same credentials across your Android app and website.

item.title: What's New in WebGPU (Chrome 131)
item.description: Clip distances in WGSL, GPUCanvasContext getConfiguration(), point and line primitives must not have depth bias, inclusive scan built-in functions for subgroups, experimental support for multi-draw indirect, shader module compilation option strict math, remove GPUAdapter requestAdapterInfo(), and more.

item.title: More options for styling <details>
item.description: You can now set the display type and also style the container for the part that expands and collapses using the new ::details-content pseudo-element.
